title: Energy and pd - proton moves between potentials

content.question: In one experiment, a proton in an electric field moves from an electric potential of <math alttext="positive 200 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mn>200</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math> to a potential of <math alttext="negative 100 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>100</mn></mpadded><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>. In this experiment, the change in electric potential energy of the proton-field system is <math alttext="delta U sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. In a second experiment, a proton in the same electric field moves from a potential of <math alttext="positive 300 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>300</mn></mpadded><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math> to a potential of <math alttext="negative 100 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>100</mn></mpadded></mpadded><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>, and the change in electric potential energy of the proton-field system is <math alttext="delta U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. What is the ratio <math alttext="the fraction with numerator delta U sub 2, and denominator delta U sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
